prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole in the Center** **Step 1: Create a 2D sketch** Start by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Within this coordinate system, create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. This sketch will be used to create the rectangular prism. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1), which in turn is made up of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4) that define a closed loop (loop\\_1). **Line 1**: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] **Line 2**: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.075] **Line 3**: Start Point [0.75, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.075] **Line 4**: Start Point [0.0, 0.075], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This closed loop defines the rectangular face of the prism, which has a length and width of 0.75 units. **Step 2: Scale the 2D sketch** Apply a uniform scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch. This will result in a smaller rectangular prism. **Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.075 units to create a 3D model of the rectangular prism. This will be the first intermediate part of the assembly. The intermediate part has a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.075 units. The part has a NewBodyFeatureOperation with respect to the preceding body. Note: For subsequent intermediate parts, please provide similar detailed instructions for creating 2D sketches, scaling, and extruding to form the intermediate parts. Also, include information about the boolean operation between the current part and the preceding body.</description>
